revised_title: Termolecular Polymerization Products of p-Benzoquinone, Toluquinone, and α-Naphthoquinone
tldr: The authors studied the formation of complex oxidation and condensation products of phenols, focusing on termolecular polymerization products of p-benzoquinone, toluquinone, and α-naphthoquinone. They discovered that these quinonoid compounds undergo termolecular polymerization, forming stable and insoluble crystalline structures. The authors also discussed the differences in the polymerization processes of benzoquinone, toluquinone, and α-naphthoquinone, and the properties of the resulting termolecular compounds.
